text: OAK STREET SCHOOL
label: HH1

text: School Accountability Status Categories
label: HH1

text: The list below defines the school status categories under New York State’s school accountability system, which is divided into
label: BODY

text: a Federal Title I component and a State component. A school that does not receive Title I funding in a school year does not have a
label: BODY

text: federal status in that year. Schools receiving Title I funds that are not in good standing must provide school choice for their students;
label: BODY

text: those in need of improvement year 2 and beyond must also provide Supplemental Education Services to eligible students. Other
label: BODY

text: consequences for schools not in good standing can be found at: www.emsc.nysed.gov/deputy/nclb/accountability/siinfo.htm. To
label: BODY

text: be removed from any improvement status, a school must make Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP) in the grade and subject for which it
label: BODY

text: was identified for two consecutive years, or in the case of a School Under Registration Review, achieve the performance targets
label: BODY

text: established for the school by the Commissioner.
label: BODY

text: School in Good Standing: A school is considered to be in
label: BODY

text: good standing if it has not been identified as a School in Need
label: BODY

text: of Improvement, Requiring Corrective Action, Planning for
label: BODY

text: Restructuring, or Requiring Academic Progress, or as a
label: BODY

text: School Under Registration Review.
label: BODY

text: School Requiring Academic Progress: Under the State
label: BODY

text: component of New York’s accountability system, a school that
label: BODY

text: does not make AYP in the same grade and subject for two
label: BODY

text: consecutive years is considered a School Requiring Academic
label: BODY

text: Progress (Year 1) for the following year. In each succeeding
label: BODY

text: year that the school fails to make AYP, the year designation is
label: BODY

text: incremented by one.
label: BODY

text: School in Need of Improvement (Year 1):  A school that has
label: BODY

text: not made AYP for two consecutive years in the same grade
label: BODY

text: and subject while receiving Title I funds is considered a School
label: BODY

text: in Need of Improvement (Year 1) for the following year.
label: BODY

text: School in Need of Improvement (Year 2):  A School in Need
label: BODY

text: of Improvement (Year 1) that does not make AYP in the grade
label: BODY

text: and subject for which it was identified while receiving Title I
label: BODY

text: funds is considered a School in Need of Improvement (Year 2)
label: BODY

text: for the following year.
label: BODY

text: School Requiring Corrective Action: A School in Need of
label: BODY

text: Improvement (Year 2) that does not make AYP in the grade
label: BODY

text: and subject for which it was identified while receiving Title I
label: BODY

text: funds is considered a School Requiring Corrective Action for
label: BODY

text: the following year.
label: BODY

text: School Planning for Restructuring:  A School Requiring
label: BODY

text: Corrective Action that does not make AYP in the grade and
label: BODY

text: subject for which it was identified while receiving Title I funds
label: BODY

text: is considered a School Planning for Restructuring for the
label: BODY

text: following year.
label: BODY

text: School Restructuring:  A School Planning for Restructuring
label: BODY

text: that does not make AYP in the grade and subject for which it
label: BODY

text: was identified while receiving Title I funds is considered a
label: BODY

text: School Restructuring for the following year.
label: BODY

text: School Under Registration Review (SURR):  Schools that
label: BODY

text: are farthest from the State standard and that have been
label: BODY

text: determined by the Commissioner to be most in need of
label: BODY

text: improvement are Schools Under Registration Review.  These
label: BODY

text: schools must achieve performance targets specified by the
label: BODY

text: Commissioner of Education in their area(s) of identification
label: BODY

text: within a prescribed timeframe or risk having their registration
label: BODY

text: revoked by the Board of Regents.
label: BODY

text: Definitions of terms, such as Performance Index and Effective Annual
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: of this report.
label: BODY

text: For a school or a district to make Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP)
label: HH1

text: in 2003–04, every accountability group must make.
label: BODY

text: For an accountability group to make AYP in 2003–04, it must
label: BODY

text: 1. meet the 95 percent participation requirement (2003–04
label: BODY

text: Participation), and
label: BODY

text: 2. either meet its Effective AMO or make safe harbor (2003–04
label: BODY

text: Performance and Standards).
label: BODY

text: To meet the participation requirement, 95 percent of the grade 4
label: BODY

text: enrollment in each accountability group with 40 or more students must
label: BODY

text: be tested. To meet the Effective AMO, the Performance Index for each
label: BODY

text: group with 30 or more continuously enrolled students must equal or
label: BODY

text: exceed the Effective AMO. To make safe harbor, the Performance Index
label: BODY

text: of each of these groups must equal or exceed its ELA safe harbor target
label: BODY

text: and the group must meet the elementary-level science qualification for
label: BODY

text: safe harbor. (See the elementary-level science page of this report for
label: BODY

text: further information on meeting the science qualification for safe harbor.)
label: BODY

text: ELA Safe Harbor Targets: The elementary-level 2003–04 ELA Safe
label: BODY

text: Harbor Target is calculated by using the following equation: 2002–03 PI
label: BODY

text: + (200 – the 2002–03 PI) × 0.10. The 2004–05 ELA Safe Harbor Target
label: BODY

text: is calculated by using the following equation: 2003–04 PI + (200 – the
label: BODY

text: 2003–04 PI) × 0.10. The 2004–05 target is provided for groups whose PI
label: BODY

text: was below the Effective AMO in 2003–04.
label: BODY

text: 2003–04, the enrollment shown is the sum of 2002–03 and 2003–04 enrollments and the percent tested is the weighted average of the participation rates over those two years.

text: Made AYP in Science in 2003–04: For a school or a district to make AYP
label: BODY

text: in science, the Performance Index (PI) for the “All Students” group must
label: BODY

text: equal or exceed the State Science Standard or the Science Progress
label: BODY

text: Target.
label: BODY

text: State Designated Level (SDL):  The score that students taking the
label: BODY

text: elementary-level science test in 2002–03 must have equaled or exceeded
label: BODY

text: on the written portion of the test to have met the State Science Standard.
label: BODY

text: Qualification for Safe Harbor in Elementary-Level ELA and Math:
label: HH1

text: For an accountability group to be considered Qualified for Safe Harbor
label: BODY

text: in Elementary-Level ELA and Math, the PI must equal or exceed the
label: BODY

text: State Science Standard or the Science Progress Target in elementary-
label: BODY

text: level science for that group. Groups with fewer than 30 students tested
label: BODY

text: in elementary-level science are not subject to this qualification criterion.
label: BODY

text: Science Progress Targets: The elementary-level 2003–04 Science
label: BODY

text: Progress Target is calculated by multiplying the 2002–03 Percent At or
label: BODY

text: Above SDL by two and then adding one point. The 2004–05 Science
label: BODY

text: Progress Target is calculated by adding one point to the 2003–04 PI.
label: BODY

text: The 2004–05 target is provided for groups whose PI was below the
label: BODY

text: State Science Standard in 2003–04.
label: BODY

text: OAK STREET SCHOOL
label: HH1

text: Glossary
label: HH1

text: Accountability Cohort: The 2000 school accountability cohort consists of all
label: HH1

text: students who first entered grade 9 in the fall of 2000, and all ungraded
label: BODY

text: students with disabilities who reached their seventeenth birthday in the
label: BODY

text: 2000–01 school year, who were enrolled on October 2, 2002. Students who
label: BODY

text: transferred to programs leading to a high school diploma or high school
label: BODY

text: equivalency diploma were not included in the 2000 school accountability
label: BODY

text: cohort. The 2000 district accountability cohort consists of all students in each
label: BODY

text: school accountability cohort plus students who transferred within the district
label: BODY

text: after BEDS day plus students who were placed outside the district by the
label: BODY

text: CSE or district administrators and who met the other requirements for cohort
label: BODY

text: membership. Cohort is defined in Section 100.2 (p) (8) of the
label: BODY

text: Commissioner’s Regulations.
label: BODY

text: Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP):  Adequate Yearly Progress (AYP)
label: BODY

text: indicates satisfactory progress by a district or a school toward the goal of
label: BODY

text: proficiency for all students.
label: BODY

text: Annual Measurable Objective (AMO): The Annual Measurable Objective
label: BODY

text: (AMO) is the PI value that signifies that an accountability group is making
label: BODY

text: satisfactory progress toward the goal that 100 percent of students will be
label: BODY

text: proficient in the State's learning standards for English language arts and
label: BODY

text: mathematics by 2013–14. The AMO will be increased in regular increments
label: BODY

text: beginning in 2004–05 until it reaches 200 in 2013–14.  (See Effective AMO
label: BODY

text: for further information.)
label: BODY

text: Continuously Enrolled Students:  Students enrolled in the school or district
label: BODY

text: on BEDS day (usually the first Wednesday in October) of the school year and
label: BODY

text: until the day of testing.
label: BODY

text: Effective Annual Measurable Objective (Effective AMO):  The Effective
label: BODY

text: Annual Measurable Objective (Effective AMO) is the PI value that each
label: BODY

text: accountability group within a school or district is expected to achieve to make
label: BODY

text: AYP. The Effective AMO is the lowest PI that an accountability group of a
label: BODY

text: given size can achieve in a subject for the group’s PI not to be considered
label: BODY

text: significantly different from the AMO for that subject. If an accountability
label: BODY

text: group's PI equals or exceeds the Effective AMO, it is considered to have
label: BODY

text: made AYP.  A more complete definition of Effective AMO and a table
label: BODY

text: showing the PI values that each group size must equal or exceed to make
label: BODY

text: AYP are available at www.emsc.nysed.gov/irts.
label: BODY

text: Graduation-Rate Cohort: Graduation-rate cohort for each year includes all
label: HH1

text: students in the accountability cohort in the previous year plus all students
label: BODY

text: excluded from that accountability cohort solely because they transferred to a
label: BODY

text: general education development (GED) program. Certain students with
label: BODY

text: severe disabilities and new immigrants were excluded from the 1999
label: BODY

text: graduation-rate cohort.
label: BODY

text: Graduation-Rate Standard: The criterion value that represents a minimally
label: BODY

text: satisfactory percentage of cohort members earning a local diploma. The
label: BODY

text: State Graduation-Rate Standard is 55 percent. The Commissioner may raise
label: BODY

text: the Graduation-Rate Standard at his discretion in future years.
label: BODY

text: Performance Index (PI):  A Performance Index is a value from 0 to 200 that
label: BODY

text: is assigned to an accountability group, indicating how that group performed
label: BODY

text: on a required State test (or approved alternative) in English language arts,
label: BODY

text: mathematics, or science. Student scores on the tests are converted to four
label: BODY

text: achievement levels, from Level 1 (indicating no proficiency) to Level 4
label: BODY

text: (indicating advanced proficiency). At the elementary and middle levels, the
label: BODY

text: PI is calculated using the following equation: 100 × [(Count of
label: BODY

text: Continuously Enrolled Tested Students Performing at Levels 2, 3, and 4
label: BODY

text: + the Count at Levels 3 and 4) ÷ Count of All Continuously Enrolled
label: BODY

text: Tested Students]. At the secondary level, the PI is calculated using the
label: BODY

text: following equation: 100 × [(Count of Cohort Members Performing at
label: BODY

text: Levels 2, 3, and 4 + the Count at Levels 3 and 4) ÷ Count of All Cohort
label: BODY

text: Members].  A list of tests used to measure student performance for
label: BODY

text: accountability is available at www.emsc.nysed.gov/irts.
label: BODY

text: Progress Target: For accountability groups below the State Standard in
label: BODY

text: science or graduation rate, the Progress Target is an alternative method for
label: BODY

text: making AYP or qualifying for safe harbor in English language arts and
label: BODY

text: mathematics based on improvement over the previous year's performance.
label: BODY

text: Safe Harbor:  Safe Harbor provides an alternative means to demonstrate
label: BODY

text: AYP for accountability groups that do not achieve their Effective AMOs in
label: BODY

text: English or mathematics.
label: BODY

text: Science Standard: The criterion value that represents a minimally
label: BODY

text: satisfactory performance in science. In 2003–04, the State Science Standard
label: BODY

text: at the elementary and middle levels was a PI of 100. The Commissioner may
label: BODY

text: raise the State Science Standard at his discretion in future years.
label: BODY
